revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: "Dorotheos to my lord and in all respects truly most beloved brother John. When I heard, my lord, the things pertaining to Aphyngios I was not a little perplexed, and then I had this fear for a long time. Therefore, my lord, only your presence can repair my reputation and restore us to the same state with the aid of your perfection. For what has happened to me has occurred before. Indeed, many report to me the very same incident. But by the power of God who guides me we will take heart. And even if we have nothing of our own, at least that which belongs to others remains. I therefore beseech you, my lord, to do what you can to get hold of my twenty solidi which by him . . .";(Verso): "To my lord John, son of Diosk[ ] "

listBibl.bibl: Janssens M, CE 52, 116-9, 1977 -- SB XIV 11882 (and p. 534) -- BL VIII, 375 (l. 3-4)
